verbose_text: Since after five days there occurred a sudden onset of fever (38.5-39degreesC), abnormalities of basal electroencephalography (EEG), specifically slow, often paroxysmal waves unresponsive to stimuli, and alterations of some blood chemistry tests (specifically, uricemia up to 8.10 mg/dL, C-reactive protein [CRP] up to 15.6 mg/dL, white blood cells up to 14.000 and VPA levels up to 85.04 mug/dL), VPA and antipsychotics were stopped.
